bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 114 (Monday, June 22, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SCHIFF:H.R. 7297.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:the Strengthening the Posse Comitatus Act isconstitutionally authorized under Article I, Section 8,Clause 18, which gives Congress the power to enact lawspursuant to the Necessary and Proper Clause, as well asArticle I, Section 8, which gives Congress the power to``provide for the common Defence'', ``to raise and supportArmies'', and ``to make Rules for the Government andRegulation of the land and naval Forces.''[Page H2414]

Strengthening the Posse Comitatus Act of 2020

To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit the use of an Armed Force under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of a military department as a posse comitatus or otherwise to execute the laws, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
